net.viktorc.detroid.framework.uci

Interface UCIEngine

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ControllerEngine, TunableEngine
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Detroid

    public interface UCIEngine
    The interface needed to be implemented by an engine to ensure it is UCI compliant.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAuthor()
      Returns the name of the author of the engine.
      DebugInformation getDebugInfo()
      Returns an observable object containing information that is not related to the game but can help detecting bugs in debug mode.
      short getHashLoadPermill()
      Returns the load factor of the hash tables in permills.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the engine.
      java.util.Map<Option<?>,java.lang.Object> getOptions()
      Returns the options the engine offers and their values.
      SearchInformation getSearchInfo()
      Returns an observable object containing information about the results and statistics of the ongoing/last search.

      Initialises the engine; e.g.
      boolean isInit()
      Returns whether the method init has already been called on the instance.
      void newGame()
      Resets the game.
      boolean play(java.lang.String pacn)
      Prompts the engine to make the move defined in Pure Algebraic Coordinate Notation.
      void ponderHit()
      Signals to the engine that the move it was pondering on was actually played and it should keep searching in normal mode.
      void quit()
      Signals the engine that it should clean up and free the resources it has been using.

      Prompts the engine to start searching the current position according to the specified parameters.

      Notifies the engine whether it should keep updating the DebugInfo instance exposed by getDebugInfo with debug information strings.

      Sets an option defined by the engine to the specified value.

      Sends the current position to the engine.
      void stop()
      Prompts the engine to stop searching and return the best move found up until that point.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
   throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialises the engine; e.g. set up the tables, load parameters, etc. The engine is not expected to function properly without calling this method on the instance first.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the engine cannot be initialized due to some reason.

      • isInit

        boolean isInit()
        Returns whether the method init has already been called on the instance.
        Returns:
        Whether the engine has been initialized.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the engine.
        Returns:
        The name of the engine.

      • getAuthor

        java.lang.String getAuthor()
        Returns the name of the author of the engine.
        Returns:
        The name of the author of the engine.

      • getOptions

        java.util.Map<Option<?>,java.lang.Object> getOptions()
        Returns the options the engine offers and their values. Changes to the map are not propagated to the engine.
        Returns:
        The UCI options the engine offers and their values.

      • setOption

        <T> boolean setOption(Option<T> setting,
                      T value)
        Sets an option defined by the engine to the specified value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value the option holds.
        Parameters:
        setting - The UCI option to set.
        value - The value to which the option should be set.
        Returns:
        Whether the setting was successfully set to the value, e.g. it was an allowed value.

      • setDebugMode

        void setDebugMode(boolean on)
        Notifies the engine whether it should keep updating the DebugInfo instance exposed by getDebugInfo with debug information strings.
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the engine should run in debug mode.

      • newGame

        void newGame()
        Resets the game. It might be a good idea for the engine to wipe the hash tables at this point.

      • setPosition

        boolean setPosition(java.lang.String fen)
        Sends the current position to the engine. The string "startpos" denotes the starting position and should be handled by the engine.
        Parameters:
        fen - The current position in FEN.
        Returns:
        Whether the position could be successfully set up.

      • play

        boolean play(java.lang.String pacn)
        Prompts the engine to make the move defined in Pure Algebraic Coordinate Notation.
        Parameters:
        pacn - The move to play in PACN.
        Returns:
        Whether the move was successfully made.

      • search

        SearchResults search(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> searchMoves,
                     java.lang.Boolean ponder,
                     java.lang.Long whiteTime,
                     java.lang.Long blackTime,
                     java.lang.Long whiteIncrement,
                     java.lang.Long blackIncrement,
                     java.lang.Integer movesToGo,
                     java.lang.Integer depth,
                     java.lang.Long nodes,
                     java.lang.Integer mateDistance,
                     java.lang.Long searchTime,
                     java.lang.Boolean infinite)
        Prompts the engine to start searching the current position according to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        searchMoves - A set of the moves to search at the root node in pure algebraic coordinate notation.
        ponder - Whether the engine should search in pondering mode.
        whiteTime - The time left on the clock for white in ms.
        blackTime - The time left on the clock for black in ms.
        whiteIncrement - Increment per move in ms.
        blackIncrement - Increment per move in ms.
        movesToGo - The number of moves until the next time control.
        depth - The depth to which the position should be searched. If it is 0, the engine should return the score determined by the quiescence search or if it is not implemented, the static evaluation score.
        nodes - The maximum number of nodes that should be searched.
        mateDistance - Search for a mate in x.
        searchTime - Search exactly this number of ms.
        infinite - Whether the position should be searched infinitely.
        Returns:
        The best move found and optionally the suggested ponder move in pure algebraic coordinate notation and optionally the search score and search score type.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Prompts the engine to stop searching and return the best move found up until that point. It should cause the search method to terminate within a few milliseconds at most. If the engine is not searching at the time of the call, it should be ignored.

      • ponderHit

        void ponderHit()
        Signals to the engine that the move it was pondering on was actually played and it should keep searching in normal mode.

      • getSearchInfo

        SearchInformation getSearchInfo()
        Returns an observable object containing information about the results and statistics of the ongoing/last search.
        Returns:
        An observable object containing information about the results and statistics of the ongoing/last search.

      • getHashLoadPermill

        short getHashLoadPermill()
        Returns the load factor of the hash tables in permills.
        Returns:
        The load factor of the hash tables in permills.

      • getDebugInfo

        DebugInformation getDebugInfo()
        Returns an observable object containing information that is not related to the game but can help detecting bugs in debug mode.
        Returns:
        An observable object containing information that is not related to the game but can help detecting bugs in debug mode.

      • quit

        void quit()
        Signals the engine that it should clean up and free the resources it has been using.
